content: Zdravím Vás. title: Ricerca su eBay
content: Salve. Da alcuni giorni, a fronte di una qualsiasi ricerca sul sito italiano di eBay fatta con una qualunque parola/frase chiave, Firefox mi restituisce una pagina deformattata/destrutturata e quasi illeggibile. Se accedo alla mia pagina italiana eBay personale, la formattazione è ok. Se accedo per una qualsiasi ricerca ad un altro sito eBay (UK, DE,...) la formattazione è ok! Qualche problema di aggiornamento italiano per Firefox oppure qualche parametro da cambiare? Ora sto operando con la versione 96.0 a 64bit. Purtroppo, se adopero un altro browser (Chrome), il problema non si presenta. Grazie. Sandro (p.s. ho anche provato ad allegare una immagine jpeg di una pagina deformattata, ma il caricamento resta pending)

title: About forced dark theme in Firefox 96.0
content:
To Firefox developer, please, REVERT THE DEFAULT THEME COLOR BACK TO LIGHT THEME. if you insist on introducing the so called "sleeker" dark theme or similar anti-mainstream things into future updates, MAKE IT OPTIONAL FOR THOSE WHO WANT TO TRY/USE IT... THEY CAN CLICK ENABLE/DISABLE-LIKE BUTTON TO SWITCH TO THE "SLEEKER" DARK THEME.

Please STOP setting-up anti-mainstream features AS DEFAULT.

I believe there are lots of people out there beside me who are also extremely annoyed about this theme color change. Sure, there is a workaround by tinkering the about:config 's layout.css.prefers-color-scheme.content-override section, but the annoyance to find out this solution, not to mention the difficulties faced by those who have less knowledge about technobable, is so bad.
creator: zha52

title: Edits can cause restart at top of large lists
content:
When copying data from a site which contains a long list (= one requiring scrolling down), any list item which references a large jpg file causes the site to reset to its top when editing of that file is completed.

Firefox should have an option which holds a long-list file at the item most recently edited or copied. It is bothersome and unnecessary to keep scrolling down a long list every time a complex copy or edit is performed.

Example: https://species.wikimedia.org/wiki/Charaxes is a typical long list. See the figure for Charaxes boueti, for an example of a figure which, when copied as a jpg, causes the list to reset to its top.

If an edit option is not added, at least ALL edits of a long list should keep the edit location displayed. Currently, this holds only for editing of simple images, not complex, multi-item images requiring jpg formatting.

title: Firefox takes a long time to connect to Ookla speed test
content:
Firefox became non-responsive yesterday while I browsing. This was on several profiles. If I closed FF and restarted it usually said FF was already running. I closed FF in Task Manager but that made no difference. Rebooted the PC but to no avail. Did these several times but made no difference. However Windows 10 Edge worked.

I restored Windows 10 back a few days & then FF worked. I then updated FF from vers 94 to vers 96. Even after FF indicated it was now vers 96 it still kept checking for updates for probably 10 minutes.

Today I did a few Ookla Speedtests. After clicking “GO” it takes about 30 seconds for the test to start, which does indicate a ping of 10 ms. Ping varies a bit with every test.

If I use the Edge browser it takes only a second or two for the test to start with approx the same ping.

This almost 30 second difference is repeatable. I never noticed such a big difference between the two browsers before.

Why does FF take so long to start the speedtest after clicking "GO"? Does this have something to do with FF vers 96? Or is there something wrong with my FF installation?

Thanks for any suggestions. Thanks
creator: Mike109

title: Title Bar in fullscreen browser window displays a thick blank space when cursor reaches top of the screen
content:
Whenever I bring my cursor to the top of the screen in fullscreen mode, there's a thick blank space that pops up and I can't figure out how to disable it.

Occasionally, it'll get stuck with it on display until I bring my cursor back up to trigger it on and off.

I've looked into all my settings, disabled all my extensions, and checked full-s in about:config, but am not sure if there's anywhere to enable/disable this feature.

Apologies if there's just some dedicated purpose to it I'm missing, but it's a little disruptive and visually jarring whenever I need to access something from my menu bar.

Thanks for the help!
